meanings.definition: To bloom more than something else.
meanings.sent1: The sunflowers outbloomed the daisies in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The roses always outbloom the tulips in our yard.
meanings.sent3: The race to outbloom each other in the flower bed was fierce.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for painting outblooms all others in the art class.
meanings.sent5: The cherry blossoms outbloomed all the other trees in the park, creating a stunning display.

meanings.sent1: The orchids outbloomed all the other flowers in the greenhouse.
meanings.sent2: Her garden always manages to outbloom the neighbors' with its vibrant colors.
meanings.sent3: The friendly competition between the roses and daisies to outbloom each other was delightful.
meanings.sent4: The rare flower's beauty outblooms anything I have ever seen.
meanings.sent5: The cherry tree seemed to outbloom the entire garden with its abundance of blossoms.

meanings.definition: To bloom outward or beyond something.
meanings.sent1: The ivy plant outblooms the trellis, reaching for the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The vines always manage to outbloom the fence they grow on.
meanings.sent3: The flowers seemed to outbloom the boundaries of the garden, spreading their beauty.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity outblooms the confines of traditional art forms.
meanings.sent5: The wildflowers outbloomed the meadow, painting it in a riot of colors.
